block.p: Moderates Gain in Iran Allies of Iran's moderate president swept most seats in a runoff election for Parliament, in what appeared to be another crushing defeat for hardliners.
Riley on Basketball and Life Pat Riley, the coach of the Miami Heat, has few regrets in his career. The most haunting one involves the Knicks, his opponent in the N.B.A. playoffs today.

The Professor of Deception In Philip Roth's novel ''The Human Stain,'' the hero-fool is a very light-skinned black man who passes for white by pretending to be Jewish; Lorrie Moore reviews the book, and Charles McGrath interviews the author.

The Inner Life What do most Americans hold closest? Across the board, according to a poll conducted for the magazine, the ability to choose for themselves what is right, good and meaningful. A special issue.
Privacy Worries, and Reality Systems that gather personal data about Web users are proving ineffective as advertisers find that the benefits of targeted marketing are exaggerated.
Animal Kingdoms In India, Lynn Sherr gets an elephant's-eye view of royal Bengal tigers; in East Africa, Michael Korda visits two luxury lodges that redefine the notion of a safari.
